int-org-section.heading: Science

alt-heading.usage: casee ass mena fea sasia eerca
ass casee mena fea eerca sasia

address.verbatim-address: POB 9573, Dar es Salaam, Tanzania

org-entry.found-date: 1977 as the Southern and Eastern Mineral Centre—SEAMIC, membership limited to Eastern and Southern African countries until 2007; subsequently opened to all African countries, present name adopted in 2015
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote socioeconomic and environmentally responsible mineral sector devt in the region and to provide advisory and consultancy services in the fields of the geosciences, mineral mining and mineral processing
provides advisory and consultancy services in exploration geology, geophysics, geochemistry, mining and mineral processing
archives and processes geospatial data
organizes training courses in the areas of geoinformatics
provides minerals related specialized laboratory services
org-entry.stats: mems: Angola, Comoros, Ethiopia, Kenya, Mozambique, Tanzania, Sudan, Uganda
org-entry.content-note: publ. Seamic Newsletter (2 a year)

org-entry.usage: ewyb edio sacac ass sasia fea

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association for Tropical Biology and Conservation

address.verbatim-address: POB 13916, Gainesville, FL 32604, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1963 as the Asscn for Tropical Biology, present name adopted in 2002
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote research and to foster exchange of ideas among biologists working in tropical environments
holds annual Congress (2024: Kigali, Rwanda, in July)
publ. Biotropica (2 a year)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of Academies and Societies of Sciences in Asia

address.verbatim-address: KAST Bldg, 3rd Floor, 42 Dolma-ro Bundang-Gu, Seongnam-si Gyeonggi-Do 13630, Republic of Korea

org-entry.found-date: 2012 by merger of the Asscn of Academies of Sciences in Asia (f. 1998) and the Fed. of Asian Scientific Academies and Societies (f. 1984)
org-entry.content-note: provides a forum for the exchange of information and advice on issues related to science and technology research and the analysis of the role of technology in socioeconomic devt

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Association of Geoscientists for International Development (AGID)

address.verbatim-address: 15 Malvern Rd, Mapperley, Nottingham, NG3 5GZ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: promotes communication and the exchange of knowledge between those interested in the application of the geosciences to international devt
contributes to the funding of geoscience devt projects
provides postgraduate scholarships
org-entry.stats: mems: 500 individual and institutional mems in 70 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Geoscience and Development (annually), Geoscience Newsletter (quarterly)

org-entry-head.alt-name: Commission internationale pour l'explor­ation scientifique de la mer Méditerranée

address.verbatim-address: Villa Girasole, 16 blvd de Suisse, 98000 Monaco

org-entry.found-date: 1919 for scientific exploration of the Mediterranean Sea
org-entry.content-note: organizes multilateral research investigations, workshops, congresses
includes 6 permanent scientific cttees
publs Congress reports

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Co-ordinating Committee for Geoscience Programmes in East and Southeast Asia (CCOP)

address.verbatim-address: CCOP Bldg, 75/10 Rama 6 Rd, Phayathai, Ratchathewi, Bangkok 10400, Thailand

org-entry.found-date: 1966 as the Co-ordinating Cttee for Coastal and Offshore Geoscience Programmes in East and Southeast Asia, present name adopted in 2002
org-entry.content-note: aims to promote and co-ordinate geo­scientific progs concerning the exploration of mineral and hydrocarbon resources and environment­ally sound coastal zone management in the offshore and coastal areas of mem. nations
works in partnership with developed nations which have provided geologists and geophysicists as tech­nical advisers
convenes annual session
org-entry.stats: mems: Brunei Darussalam, Cambodia, People's Rep. of China, Indonesia, Japan, Rep. of Korea, Lao People’s Democratic Rep., Malaysia, Mongolia, Myanmar, Papua New Guinea, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Viet Nam
org-entry.content-note: publs CCOP Newsletter (quarterly), Technical Bulletin , Technical Publication , CCOP Map Series , Proceedings of Annual Session , other technical reports

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Council for International Congresses of Entomology

org-entry.content-note: works to provide continuity and direction for the International Congress of Entomology (ICE), held every 4 years (27th Congress: Kyoto, Japan, in 2024)
the Council serves as the entomology section of the International Union of Biological Sciences

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Council of Managers of National Antarctic Programs

address.verbatim-address: Private Bag 4800, Gateway Antarctica, University of Canterbury, Ilam Rd, Christchurch, New Zealand

org-entry.content-note: brings together National Antarctic Progs, developed by signatories to the Antarctic Treaty, with the aim of developing and promoting best practice in managing the support of scientific research in Antarctica

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: European Association of Geoscientists and Engineers (EAGE)

address.verbatim-address: De Molen 42, POB 59, 3990 DB Houten, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the applications of geoscience and related subjects and to foster co-operation between those working or studying in the fields
organizes confs, workshops, education programmes and exhibitions
seeks global co-operation with orgs with similar objectives
85th EAGE Annual Conference and Exhibition: Oslo, Norway, in June 2024
publs Geophysical Prospecting (6 a year), Petroleum Geoscience (quarterly), Near Surface Geophysics (6 a year), Basin Research (6 a year)

address.verbatim-address: Meyerhofstr. 1, Postfach 1022.40, 69117 Heidelberg, Germany

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote collaboration in the field of molecular biology and to establish fellowships for training and research
established the European Molecular Biology Labor­atory where a majority of the disciplines comprising the subject are represented
org-entry.stats: mems: approx. 1,800 elected mems in Europe and assoc. mems worldwide
org-entry.content-note: publs Facts and Figures , The EMBO Journal (24 a year), Molecular Systems Biology (26 a year), EMBO Molecular Medicine , Molecular Systems Biology , Life Science Alliance (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: Esplanade des Particules 1, 1211 Geneva 23, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: facilitates collaboration among European states in nuclear research of a pure scientific and fundamental character, for peaceful purposes only
major experimental facilities: Proton Synchrotron (of 25-28 GeV), Super Proton Synchrotron (of 450 GeV), and Large Hadron Collider (of 14 TeV)
in July 2012 preliminary results of the Compact Muon Solenoid (CMS) and ATLAS experiments indicated the discovery of the hitherto elusive Higgs particle
org-entry.stats: mems: 23 countries; observers: Japan, USA, European Union, UNESCO (the observer status of the Russian Fed. was suspended in March 2022)
org-entry.content-note: publs CERN Courier (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: c/o CEA, Bãt. BARD 1, Centre DAM, Ile de France, Bruyères le Chãtel, 91297 Arpajon Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: supports rapid determination of seismic hypocentres in the region
maintains database
org-entry.stats: mems: 5 key nodal mem. institutions, 66 active mem. institutions/observatories/laboratories, 4 mems by right
org-entry.content-note: publ. Newsletter (2 a year)

address.verbatim-address: 24 rue du Général Bertrand, CS 30798, 75345 Paris Cedex 8, France

org-entry.content-note: fmrly the European Space Research Organisation and the European Launcher Development Organisation
provides for, and promotes, European co-operation in space research and technology, and their applications, for exclusively peaceful purposes
puts into effect a long-term European space policy of scientific research and technological devt

in 2003 ESA and the Russian Government signed an Agreement on Co-operation and Partnership in the Exploration and Use of Outer Space for Peaceful Purposes, and co-operation was pursued between ESA and the Russian Federal Space Agency (Roscosmos); in March 2022, following Russia’s military invasion of Ukraine, the ESA Council suspended the joint ESA-Roscosmos ExoMars mission (to verify the existence of organic life on Mars); Russia, meanwhile, withdrew its personnel from the Guiana Space Centre in late Feb., and halted all launches of its Soyez carrier rockets from there; an initial statement by Roscosmos that, pending the withdrawal of sanctions against Russia, it would suspend co-operation concerning the International Space Station was reversed and in April 2023 Russia approved an extension of the existing partnership arrangements until 2028
publs ESA Annual Report , Acta Futura

address.verbatim-address: 59 St Andrew's St, Cambridge, CB2 3BZ, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: promotes the science of biochemistry through meetings of European biochemists, advanced courses and the provision of fellowships
holds annual congress
org-entry.stats: mems: approx. 30,000 in more than 39 socs
org-entry.content-note: publs The FEBS Journal , FEBS Open Bio , FEBS Letters , Molecular Oncology

address.verbatim-address: 401 Park Ave,Suite 873, New York, NY 10016, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1943 as the International Society for General Semantics to ad­vance knowledge of and inquiry into non-Aristotelian systems and general semantics
org-entry.content-note: merged with Institute of General Semantics (f. 1938) in 2004
publ. ETC: A Review of General Semantics (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Inter-American Network of Academies of Sciences

address.verbatim-address: c/o Beatriz Caputto, Argentinian Academy of Sciences, Vélez Sarsfield 249, Córdoba, Argentina

org-entry.found-date: 2004 as a regional network of the Academies of the Sciences
org-entry.content-note: aims to build and assist national scientific capacities through shared research and technical knowledge
provides a forum for co-operation and decision making for the scientific communities of the region
publs scientific research reports

address.verbatim-address: UNESCO, 7 pl. Fontenoy, 75007 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: promotes scientific investigation of the nature and resources of the oceans through the concerted action of its mems
supports GenOcean, the awareness-raising campaigning of the UN Ocean Decade 2021-30
publs IOC Tech­nical Series (irregular), other manuals, workshop reports, annual reports

address.verbatim-address: POB 1268-16, 75766 Paris Cedex 16, France

org-entry.content-note: fosters the devt of astronautics for peaceful purposes, holds scientific meetings and makes scientific studies
maintains a multilingual terminology database (23 languages)
publs Acta Astronautica (monthly), and book series, dictionaries, etc.

address.verbatim-address: 3 rue Mina-Audemars, 1204 Geneva, Switzerland

org-entry.found-date: 1919; reconstituted in 1955 as the International Asscn for Biological Standardization, later the International Asscn for Biologicals
org-entry.content-note: aims to connect producers and controllers of immunological pro­ducts (sera, vaccines, etc.), for the study and devt of methods of standardization
supports international orgs in their efforts to address problems of standardization
org-entry.stats: mems: approx. 250 mems in some 50 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Newsletter (quarterly), Biologicals (6 a year)

address.verbatim-address: Ken chiku-kaikan Bldg, 4th Floor, 5-26-20, Shiba, Minato-ku, Tokyo 108-0014, Japan

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote international co-operation among scientists and engineers in the field of earthquake engineering through exchange of knowledge, ideas and results of research and practical experience
publ. Earthquake Engineering and Structural Dynamics

address.verbatim-address: c/o Prof. Eun-Shik Kim, Department of Forestry, Environment, and Systems, Kookmin University, Songbuk-gu, Seoul 136-702, Republic of Korea

org-entry.content-note: aims to provide opportunities for communication among ecologists worldwide, to co-operate with orgs and individuals having related aims and interests and to en­courage studies in the different fields of ecology
affiliated to the International Union of Biological Sciences
holds International Congress of Ecology every 4 years (2022: Geneva, Switzerland, in Aug.-Sept.)
publ. Oecologia

address.verbatim-address: 10580 N McCarran Blvd, Reno, NV 89503, USA

org-entry.found-date: 1968 as the International Asscn of Mathematical Geology (present name adopted in 2007)
org-entry.content-note: supports the preparation and elaboration of mathema­tical models of geo­logical processes
the introduction of mathematical methods in geo­logical sciences and technology
assistance in the devt of mathe­matical investigation in geological sciences
the organization of international collaboration in mathematical geology through various forums and publs
educational pro­gs for mathe­matical geology

publs Applied Computing and Geosciences (online), Computers and Geosciences (monthly), Encyclopedia of Mathematical Geosciences , Mathematical Geosciences (8 a year), Natural Resources Research (quarterly), monograph series

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association for Mathematics and Computers in Simulation

address.verbatim-address: 98 rue du Trône, 1050 Brussels, Belgium

org-entry.found-date: 1955 (as International Asscn for Analogue Computation, present name adopted in 1976)
org-entry.content-note: aims to further the study of math­ematical tools and computer software and hardware, analogue, digital or hybrid computers for simulation of soft or hard systems
regular confs and events are sponsored by some 25 technical cttees
publs Journal of Computational Acoustics , Applied Numerical Mathematics , Mathematics and Computers in Simulation

address.verbatim-address: Institute of Botany, Slovak Academy of Sciences, 9 Dubravska cesta, 845-23 Bratislava, Slovakia

org-entry.content-note: promotes the devt of plant taxonomy and encourages contacts between people and institutes interested in this work
maintains the International Bureau for Plant Taxonomy and Nomenclature
affiliated to the Inter­national Union of Biological Sciences
publs Taxon (quarterly), Regnum vegetabile (irregular)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association for the Physical Sciences of the Oceans (IAPSO)

address.verbatim-address: CNR-Istituto di Scienze Marine, Area Science Park, Basovizza Q2, 34149 Trieste, Italy

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote the study of scientific problems relating to the oceans and interactions occurring at its boundaries, chiefly in so far as such study may be carried out by the aid of mathematics, physics and chemistry
to initiate, facilitate and co-ordinate oceanic research
and to provide for discussion, comparison and publication
affiliated to the International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association for the Plant Protection Sciences (IAPPS)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Dept of Entomology, University of Nebraska, Lincoln, NE 68583-0816, USA

org-entry.content-note: promotes an integrated approach to plant protection and the devt and implementation of ecologically sustainable plant protection practices
organizes an International Plant Protection Congress every 4 years (20th Congress: Athens, Greece, in July 2024)

address.verbatim-address: c/o IABG Secretariat, South China Botanical Garden, 723 Xingke Rd, Tianhe Dist, Guangzhou 510560, People’s Republic of China

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-operation between scientific collections of living plants, including the exchange of information and specimens
to promote the study of the taxonomy of cultivated plants
and to encourage the conservation of rare plants and their habitats
affiliated to the Inter­national Union of Biological Sciences
aims to encourage research on cryospheric sciences through collaboration and co-operation among individuals, institutions, and research progs, both nationally and internationally
also aims to provide opportunities for international discussion and publication of the results of research on cryospheric structures and processes
affiliated to the International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics (IUGG)

address.verbatim-address: Finnish Geospatial Research Institute FGI, Vuorimiehentie 5, 02150 Espoo, Finland

org-entry.content-note: promotes the study of all scientific problems of geodesy and encourages geodetic research; promotes and co-ordinates international co-operation in this field and publishes findings
affiliated to the International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics
publs Journal of Geodesy

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Geomagnetism and Aeronomy (IAGA)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Monika Korte, Telegrafenberg 14473, Potsdam, Germany

org-entry.content-note: aims to study questions relating to geomagnet­ism and aeronomy and to encourage of research
holds General and Scientific Assem­blies every 2 years
affiliated to the International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics (IUGG)
mems: 5,000
publs IAGA Reporter Reviews , IAGA Newsletter , IAGA Guides

address.verbatim-address: c/o Jean-Marie Kileshye Onema, North-West University, Mahikeng, Private Bag X2046, Mmabatho, 2745, South Africa

org-entry.content-note: promotes co-operation in the study of hydrology and water resources
publs Hydrological Sciences Journal , proceedings

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Meteorology and Atmospheric Sciences (IAMAS)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Dept of Atmospheric and Oceanic Sciences, University of Wisconsin-Madison, 1225 West Dayton St, Madison, WI 53706, USA

org-entry.content-note: maintains permanent commissions on atmospheric ozone, radiation, atmospheric chemistry and global pollution, dynamic meteorology, polar meteorology, clouds and precipitation, climate, atmospheric electricity, planetary atmo­spheres and their evolution, and meteorology of the upper atmo­sphere
affiliated to the International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics

address.verbatim-address: c/o Dept of Geology and Soil Science, Ghent University, Krijgslaan 281, 9000 Ghent, Belgium

org-entry.content-note: affiliated to the International Union of Geological Sciences
organizes International Sedimentological Congress every 4 years (2026: Wellington, New Zealand)
publs Basin Research , Sedimentology (every 2 months), The Depositional Record

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Association of Volcanology and Chemistry of the Earth's Interior (IAVCEI)

address.verbatim-address: Dipartimento di Scienze della Terra e Geoambientali, Università di Bari, Italy

org-entry.content-note: promotes the scientific study of all aspects of volcanology
publs Bulletin of Volcanology , Catalogue of the Active Volcanoes of the World , Proceedings in Volcanology

address.verbatim-address: c/o Naturalis Biodiversity Center, POB 9517, 2300 Leiden, Netherlands

org-entry.content-note: promotes the study, documentation and exchange of information on the structure of wood
publ. IAWA Journal

address.verbatim-address: 100 ave de Suffren, 75015 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: fosters the devt of astronautics for peaceful pur­poses at national and international level, encourages the advancement of knowledge about space and the devt and application of space assets for the benefit of humanity

organizes an annual International Astronautical Congress (2024: Milan, Italy, in Oct.) in conjunction with its associates, the International Academy of Astronautics and the International Institute of Space Law
publs IAF Newsletter , IAF Highlights Journal

address.verbatim-address: 98 bis blvd d'Arago, 75014 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: facilitates co-operation between the astronomers of various countries and to further the study of astronomy in all its branches; organizes colloquia every 2 months
publs IAU Colloquia , Symposia Series (6 a year), Highlights (every 3 years)

address.verbatim-address: 1120 20th St, NW, Suite 750, Washington, DC 20005, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to advance quantitative biological science through the devt of quantitative theories and the application, devt and dissemination of effective mathematical and statistical techniques
affiliated with International Union of Biological Sciences
holds International Biometric Conference every 2 years
org-entry.stats: mems: over 6,000 in more than 80 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs Biometrics (quarterly), Biometric Journal (quarterly), Journal of Agricultural, Biological and Environmental Statistics , (quarterly) Biostatistics and Epidemiology
communicates advances in plant sciences
the Nomenclature Section of the Congress attempts to provide a uniform terminology and methodology for the naming of plants
other div­isions deal with developmental, metabolic, structural, systematic and evolutionary, ecological botany
genetics and plant breeding
congress convened every 6 years (2024: Madrid, Spain, in July)
affiliated to the International Union of Biological Sciences

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Bureau of Weights and Measures
org-entry-head.alt-name: Bureau international des poids et mesures—BIPM

address.verbatim-address: Pavillon de Breteuil, 92312 Sèvres Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: works to ensure the international unification of measurements and their traceability to the International System of Units
carries out research and calibration
organizes international comparisons of national measurement standards
publs Metrologia (6 a year), scientific articles, reports and monographs, cttee reports

address.verbatim-address: c/o Eotvos University, Dept of Cartography and Geoinformatics, H-1117 Budapest, Pazmany Peter setany 1/A, Hungary

org-entry.content-note: works to advance, instigate and co-ordinate cartographic research involving co-operation between different nations

particularly concerned with the furtherance of training in cartography, the study of source material, compilation, graphic design, digital presentation of maps as artefacts communicating geographic information
organizes an international conf. every 2 years (31st: Cape Town, South Africa, in Aug. 2023), as well as symposia, meetings, exhibi­t­ions
org-entry.stats: mems: 75 national asscns, socs or institutes
org-entry.content-note: publs ICA Newsletter (2 a year), International Journal of Cartography

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Centre of Insect Physiology and Ecology

address.verbatim-address: POB 30772-00100, Nairobi, Kenya

org-entry.content-note: aims to alleviate poverty, ensure food security and improve the overall health status of peoples of the tropics through developing and extending tools and strategies for managing harmful and useful arthropods, while preserving the natural resource base through research and capacity building
publ. International Journal of Tropical Insect Science (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Institut d'Optique, Graduate School, 2 ave Augustin Fresnel, Palaiseau, 91127 Paris Cedex, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to contribute to the progress and diffusion of know­ledge in the field of optics and photonics; co-ordinates the dissemination and advancement of scientific and technical knowledge relating to optics and photonics
holds General Assembly every 3 years (2024: Dakar, Senegal, in Sept.-Oct.)
org-entry.stats: mems: cttees in 53 territories, and 7 int. socs
org-entry.content-note: publs ICO Newsletter , ICO Triennial Report

address.verbatim-address: 50 Stone Rd East, Guelph, ON N1G 2W1, Canada

org-entry.content-note: promotes research and its application in the field of bee botany, and collects and spreads information; organizes meetings and collaborates with scientific orgs
affiliated to the International Union of Biolo­gical Sciences
aims to encourage and develop international collaboration in the improvement and extension of the methods and scope of physics education at all levels
collaborates with UNESCO and organizes international confs (2018: Johannesburg, South Africa, in Oct.)
mems: appointed triennially by the International Union of Pure and Applied Physics

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Commission on Radiation Units and Measure­ments, Inc (ICRU)

address.verbatim-address: 7910 Woodmont Ave, Suite 400, Bethesda, MD 20814-3095, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to develop internationally acceptable recommendations regarding quantities and units of radiation and radio­activity; procedures suitable for the measurement and application of these quantities in clinical radio­logy and radio­biology; and physical data needed in the application of these procedures
makes recommendations on quantities and units for radiation protection
publs Journal of the ICRU (2 a year), and reports

address.verbatim-address: c/o Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum, 2 Conservatory Dr., Singapore 117377

org-entry.content-note: has judicial powers to determine all matters relating to the interpretation of the International Code of Zoological Nomenclature and also plenary powers to suspend the operation of the Code where its strict application would lead to confusion and instability of nomenclature
also responsible for maintaining and developing the Official Lists and Official Indexes of Names and Works in Zoology
publ. Bulletin of Zoological Nomenclature (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council for Scientific and Technical Information

address.verbatim-address: 5 rue Ambroise Thomas, 75009 Paris, France

org-entry.found-date: 1984 as the successor to the International Council of Scientific Unions Abstracting Board (f. 1952)
org-entry.content-note: aims to increase accessibility to scientific and technical information
fosters communication and interaction among all participants in the information transfer chain

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea (ICES)

address.verbatim-address: H. C. Andersens Blvd 44-46, 1553 Copenhagen V, Denmark

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage and facilitate research on the utilization and conservation of living resources and the environment in the North Atlantic Ocean and its adjacent seas
publishes and disseminates results of marine research
advises mem. countries and regulatory commissions
granted observer status at the UN General Assembly in Dec. 2018
org-entry.stats: mems: 20 countries, partnership agreements with other int. orgs
org-entry.content-note: publs ICES Journal of Marine Science , TIMES—ICES Techniques in Marine Environmental Sciences

address.verbatim-address: POB 20371, Boulder, CO 80308, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to advance psychology and the application of its scientific findings
holds annual conventions
publs International Psychologist (quarterly), World Psychology (quarterly)

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Council of the Aeronautical Sciences

address.verbatim-address: c/o DGLR, Godesberger Allee 70, 53175 Bonn, Germany

org-entry.content-note: founded to encourage free interchange of information on aeronautical science and technology
holds biennial Congresses (2024: Florence, Italy, in Sept.)
org-entry.stats: mems: nat. asscns in more than 30 countries

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service

address.verbatim-address: Central Bureau, c/o Bundesamt für Kartographie und Geodäsie (BKG), Richard-Strauss-Allee 11, 60598 Frankfurt am Main, Germany

org-entry.found-date: 1988 (fmrly International Polar Motion Service and Bureau International de l'Heure)
org-entry.content-note: maintained by the International Astronomical Union and the International Union of Geodesy and Geophysics
defines and maintains the inter­national terrestrial and celestial reference systems
determines earth orientation parameters (ter­restrial and celestial co-ordinates of the pole and universal time) connecting these systems
monitors global geophysical fluids
organizes collection, analysis and dissemination of data
publ. IERS Bulletin

address.verbatim-address: Dept of Structural and Functional Biology, State University of Biology, Charles Darwin St, Campinas, SP 13083-863, Brazil

org-entry.content-note: organizes regular international congresses (2022: Taipei, Rep. of China, in Nov.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 17 full mem. socs, 4 reg. orgs, 18 assoc. and 3 affiliated socs
org-entry.content-note: publs Cell Biology International (monthly), reports

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Operational Research Societies (IFORS)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Gavin Blackett, 12 Edward Street, Birmingham, B1 2RX, United Kingsom

org-entry.content-note: promotes the devt of operational research as a unified science
org-entry.stats: mems: c. 30,000 individuals, 50 nat. socs, 4 reg. groupings
org-entry.content-note: publ. International Transactions in Operational Research

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Federation of Societies for Microscopy (IFSM)

org-entry.content-note: promotes and co-ordinates research in order to contribute to the advancement of all aspects of electron microscopy
sponsors meetings and confs
holds International Microscopy Congress every 4 years (2023: Busan, Rep. of Korea, in Sept.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 36 orgs, 3 reg. mems and 7 assoc. socs

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Foundation of the High-Altitude Research Stations Jungfraujoch and Gornergrat

address.verbatim-address: Sidlerstr. 5, 3012 Bern, Switzerland

org-entry.content-note: international research centre which enables scientists from many scientific fields to carry out experiments at high altitudes
org-entry.stats: 5 countries contri­bute to support the station: Austria, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, UK

address.verbatim-address: c/o Prof. Dr Barbaros Gönençgil, Dept of Geography, Faculty of Letters, University of Istanbul, Ordu Cad. 196, Laleli, Istanbul, Türkiye

org-entry.content-note: aims to encourage the study of problems relating to geography, to promote and co-ordinate research requiring international co-operation, and to organize international congresses and commissions
publ. IGU Bulletin ­(annually)

address.verbatim-address: High Cross, Madingley Rd, Cambridge, CB3 0ET, United Kingdom

org-entry.content-note: aims to stimulate interest in and encourage research into the scientific and technical problems associated with snow and ice
publs Journal of Glaciology (6 a year), Annals of Glaciology (3-4 a year)

address.verbatim-address: 4 b Quai Antoine 1er, BP 445, 98000 Monaco

org-entry.content-note: links the hydro­graphic offices of mem. govts and co-ordinate their work, with a view to rendering navigation easier and safer
seeks to obtain, as far as possible, uniformity in charts and hydrographic documents
fosters the devt of electronic chart navigation
encourages adoption of the best methods of conducting hydrog­raphic surveys
encourages sur­veying in those parts of the world where accurate charts are lacking
administers an Empowering Women in Hydrography (EWH) project
organizes an Assembly every 3 years
manages jtly with the Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission a General Bathymetric Chart of Oceans (GEBCO) mapping and data collection project and GEBCO Sub-Committee on Undersea Feature Names
provides IHO Data Centre for Digital Bathymetry
a Joint IHO-Singapore Innovation and Technology Laboratory was inaugurated in Oct. 2021
publs International Hydrographic Review , IHO Bulletin (English, French and Spanish), IHO Yearbook , other documents (available on the IHO website)

address.verbatim-address: 177 blvd Males­herbes, 75017 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to further the science of refrigeration and its applications
investigates, discusses and recommends any aspects leading to improvements in the field of refrigeration
convenes confs and seminars
org-entry.stats: mems: over 500 corpns, 1,000 individuals, in 59 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. International Journal of Refrigeration (monthly)

address.verbatim-address: Hausvogteiplatz 11 a , 10117 Berlin, Germany

org-entry.content-note: established to support and assist the International Congress of Mathemati­cians and other international scientific meetings or confs and to encourage and support other international math­ematical activities considered likely to contribute to the devt of mathematical science—pure, applied or educational

address.verbatim-address: c/o Hiroaki Ohfuji, Department of Earth Science, Graduate School of Science, Tohoku University 6-3 Aramaki-Aza-Aoba 980-8578 Sendai, Japan

org-entry.content-note: aims to further international co-operation in the science of mineralogy
affiliated to the International Union of Geological Sciences

address.verbatim-address: 11 rue Turgot, 75009 Paris, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to serve as documentation and information centre on the verification, checking, construction and use of measuring instruments, to determine characteristics and standards to which measuring instruments must conform for their use to be recommended internationally, and to determine the general principles of legal metrology
publ. Bulletin (quarterly)

address.verbatim-address: Suuruspääntie 11 C 9, 40520 Jyväskylä, Finland

org-entry.content-note: supports co-operation in the study and use of mires, peatlands, peat and related material, through international meetings, research groups and the exchange of information

address.verbatim-address: c/o Centre for Industrial Electronics, University of Southern Denmark, Alsion 2 d , Sonderborg, 6400 Denmark

org-entry.content-note: promotes the scientific study of phonetics and its applications; organizes International Congress of Phonetic Sciences every 4 years (2023: Prague, Czech Rep., in Aug.)

org-entry.found-date: 1960 to promote the study of algae, the distri­bution of information, and international co-operation in this field; organizes International Phycological Congresses every 4 years (2021: virtually, in March)
org-entry.content-note: publ. Phyco­logia (every 2 months)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Pontificia Universidade Catolica do Rio Grande do Sul, Porto Alegre, RS 90619-900, Brazil

org-entry.content-note: promotes primatological science in all fields, as well as int. co-operation

publs IPS Bulletin , International Journal of Primatology

address.verbatim-address: c/o Bernard Le Guen, EDF Generation, Site Cap Ampère, 1 pl. Pleyel, 93282 Saint Denis, France

org-entry.content-note: aims to link individuals and socs throughout the world concerned with protection against ionizing radiations and allied effects, and to represent doctors, health physicists, radiological protection officers and others engaged in radiological protection, radiation safety, nuclear safety, legal, medical and veterinary aspects and in radiation research and other allied activities
organizes International Congress every 4 years (2021: held in a virtual format in Jan.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 19,000 individuals, 53 assoc. socs in 68 countries
org-entry.content-note: publ. IRPA Bulletin

address.verbatim-address: 5 rue Auguste Vacquerie, 75116 Paris, France

org-entry.found-date: 2018, by the merger of the fmr International Council for Science (f. 1931 as a result of expansion of International Association of Academies—f. 1899, and International Research Council—f. 1919) with the fmr International Social Science Council (f. 1952)
org-entry.content-note: incorporates national scientific bodies and International Scientific Unions, as well as Interdisciplinary Bodies (international scientific networks established to address specific areas of investigation)
through its global network co-ordinates interdisciplinary research to address major issues of relevance to both science and society
advocates for freedom in the conduct of science, promotes equitable access to scientific data and information, and facilitates science education and capacity building

Interdisciplinary Bodies and Joint Initiatives: Future Earth; Urban Health and Well-being; Cttee on Space Research; Scientific Cttee on Antarctic Research; Scientific Cttee on Oceanic Research; Scientific Cttee on Solar-Terrestrial Physics; Integrated Research on Disaster Risk; Programme on Ecosystem Change and Society; DIVERSITAS; International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme; International Human Dimensions Programme on Global Environmental Change; World Climate Research Programme; Global Climate Observing System; Global Ocean Observing System; Global Terrestrial Observing System; Cttee on Data for Science and Technology; International Network for the Availability of Scientific Publications; Scientific Cttee on ­Frequency Allocations for Radio Astronomy and Space Science; World Data System

General Assembly of leading scientists meets every 3 years to formulate policy and priorities; 2nd trienniel ISC General Assembly: online, in Oct. 2021 (3rd scheduled to be held in Muscat, Oman, in Jan. 2025)
org-entry.stats: mems: 245 nat. and regional scientific orgs (incl. academies and research councils), and Int. Scientific Unions and Asscns

encourages the publication of research

affiliated to International Council for Science
organizes seminars, workshops, scientific confs

org-entry.stats: mems: 100 national bodies and over 40,000 individuals

address.verbatim-address: 5034 a Thoroughbred Lane, Brentwood, TN 37027, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to promote co-ordination of research, discussion and publication in the field of pharmacology, including clinical pharma­cology, drug metabolism and toxicology

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: International Union of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology (IUBMB)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Prof. Iqbal Parker, Div. of Medical Biochemistry, Faculty of Health Sciences, Private Bag X3, Observatory, Cape Town 7935, South Africa

org-entry.content-note: established to sponsor the International Con­gresses of Biochemistry, to co-ordinate research and discussion, to organize co-operation between the societies of biochemistry and molecular biology, to promote high standards of biochemistry and molecular biology throughout the world and to contribute to the advancement of biochemistry and molecular biology in all its international aspects
organizes international congress (2024: Melbourne, Australia, in Sept.)
org-entry.stats: mems: 75 bodies, 4 reg. orgs and 3 assoc. orgs
org-entry.content-note: publs Trends in Biochemical Sciences (TIBS) (monthly), Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Education , BioFactors , Biotechnology and Applied Biochemistry , IUBMB Life , Molecular Aspects of Medicine , Trends in Biochemical Sciences

address.verbatim-address: Bãt 442, Université Paris-Sud 11, 91405 Orsay Cedex, France

administers scientific programmes on biodiversity, integrative biology (of ageing, bioenergy and climate change), biological education, bioethics, bioenergy and Darwin 200
carries out international collaborative research programmes
convenes General Assembly every 3 years (2023: Tokyo, Japan, in March)
org-entry.stats: mems: more than 110 nat., scientific, and institutional mems
org-entry.content-note: publs Biology International (quarterly), IUBS Monographs , Methodology Manual Series

address.verbatim-address: 5 Abbey Sq., Chester, CH1 2HU, United Kingdom

address.verbatim-address: IUGG Secretariat, Helmholtz Centre Potsdam, GFZ German Research Centre for Geosciences, Telegrafenberg A17, 14473 Potsdam, Germany

org-entry.content-note: fed. of 8 asscns representing Cryospheric Sciences, Geodesy, Geomagnetism and Aeronomy, Hydrological Sciences, Meteor­ology and Atmospheric Physics, Seismology and Physics of the Earth's Interior, Physical Sciences of the Ocean, and Volcanology and Chemistry of the Earth's Interior, which meet at the General Assemblies of the Union; organizes scientific meetings and sponsors various permanent services to collect, analyse and publish geophysical data

org-entry.stats: mems: regular and assoc. mems in 73 countries
org-entry.content-note: publs IUGG Yearbook , IUGG Electronic Journal (monthly), Journal of Geodesy (quarterly), IASPEI Newsletter (irregular), Bulletin of Volcanology (8 a year), Hydrological Sciences Journal (6 a year), IAMAS Newsletter (irregular)

address.verbatim-address: c/o Ma Yongzheng, 26 Baiwanzhuang Rd, Xicheng District, Beijing, People’s Republic of China

organizes international meetings and co-sponsors jt programmes, including the International Geological Correlation Prog. (with UNESCO)

org-entry.stats: mems: 58 adhering bodies, 14 assoc., 5 reg., 3 affiliated mems

org-entry.stats: mems: 93 nat., 7 reg., and 19 affiliate orgs

address.verbatim-address: POB 13757, Research Triangle Park, NC 27709-3757, USA

org-entry.content-note: aims to organize permanent co-operation between chemical asscns in the mem. countries, to study topics of international importance requiring standardization or codification, to co-operate with other international orgs in the field of chemistry and to contribute to the advancement of all aspects of chemistry

org-entry.stats: mems: 29 assoc. orgs and 1,000 affiliates in more than 50 countries

org-entry.content-note: aims to stimulate and co-ordinate, on an international basis, studies, research, applications, scientific exchange and communication in the field of radio science
also aims to encourage the adoption of common methods of measurement and the standardization of measuring instruments used in scientific work

address.verbatim-address: 56 ave des Arts, 1000 Brussels, Belgium

address.verbatim-address: International House, Annie Jiagge Rd, University of Ghana, Legon, Accra, Ghana

org-entry.content-note: operational since 1990

aims at human resource devt and institutional capacity building through co-ordination with African universities and research institutes in advanced research, training and dissemination of knowledge and information on the conservation and management of Africa's natural resources and their rational utilization for sustainable devt

address.verbatim-address: c/o Prof. Raul Espejo, 3 North Pl., 30 Nettleham Rd, Lincoln, LN2 1RE, United Kingdom
